Welcome!

I am a recent graduate of the University of Maryland, where I received dual degrees in Neuroscience and Persian Studies, with a Minor in Health, Humanities, & Medicine. I am currently a research assistant at the Johns Hopkins Center for OCD, Anxiety, and Related Disorders for Children (COACH), where I am working on projects to better understand the neural mechanisms underlying several neurospychiatric disorders.

Nathan Boyle

  • (2024) B.S. Neuroscience, U of Maryland
  • (2024) B.A. Persian Studies, U of Maryland
